Counter Strike Source : Valve's version of the classic CS1.6, as with the original take some time to understand how each of the guns work and the physics in the game. So many people already have this basic knowledge that you will be at a slight disadvantage if you don't recognize that spamming a gun makes the bullets skyrocket up even though your crosshair is still perfectly straight.

[h1] Dollar for dollar Counter-Strike: Source is the best game investment I ever made and it's my all-time favorite game. [/h1]


As I look at the 80+ Games in my library, most of them never got past 100 hours, only a few over 500 hours. I have spent thousands of hours in CSS. In that time, I have been a part of many awesome gaming communities. In general, the attitude is more lighthearted and friendly within gaming communities because they have standards and admins to keep the game play fair, competitive and most of all fun. 

When CS:GO came out I gave it a try and did not like it. The community seemed somewhat toxic and I did not care for the mechanics as much as I do Source. I admit I am a filthy casual who obsessively plays Deathmatch because I hate waiting for anything (like the next round). Go Go Go

I have been an admin on many CSS Servers and happy to say it is still a popular game with a lot of great maps and a lot of fun. My favorite DM map of all time is Crackhouse.

I currently play at:
connect 192.223.31.71:27015 (in console)
░▓█► The Best CRACKHOUSE [DM] :: ÀωÞclan.com (14/32)

Visit the link below to see the rest of our servers and introduce yourself on our forums. 
http://www.awpclan.com

Our gaming community is very active and has a lot of servers. If you are looking for a fun, friendly place to play please drop by one of our servers and give us a round or two to convince you to join us.

Esse é aquele bom e velho jogo que nunca vai sair de moda né? Simplesmente o jogo mais viciante que existe. Quando você começa a jogar, acho muito dificil que pare de jogar com facilidade. Graficos não tão bons quanto os novos concorrentes, Bad Company 2 por exemplo. Porém, possui jogabilidade ótima, e um nivel de disputa muito elevado. Tecnica para atirar não é tudo que o jogo exige de você para ser um bom player. Trabalho em equipe, "catimba" e muita marotagem também são primordiais nesse game. Tudo isso junto, te torna um ótimo player de CS Source (:
Recomandadíssimo! Viva o CS Source e FORA CS GO!
